The all-new iPad is colorfully reimagined to be more capable, more intuitive, and even more fun. With a new all‑screen design, a 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display, and four gorgeous colors, the iPad delivers a powerful way to get things done, create, and stay connected.1 Add on essential accessories designed just for iPad and enjoy endless versatility for everything you love to do.Powerful A14 Bionic ChipiPad 10th Generation is Equipped with the A14 Bionic chip featuring a 6-core CPU, 4-core graphics, and a 16-core Neural Engine for high-performance computing.Immersive Liquid Retina DisplayFeatures a 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display with IPS technology, providing a vivid visual experience with a resolution of 2360×1640 pixels.Storage OptionsAvailable in two storage configurations – 64GB and 256GB, offering ample space for apps, media, and files.Advanced Camera SystemBoasts a 12MP Wide camera with ƒ/1.8 aperture, 5x digital zoom, Smart HDR 3, and various camera features for detailed and vibrant photos.Front Camera CapabilitiesFronted by a landscape 12MP Ultra Wide camera with a 122° field of view, Smart HDR 3, and 1080p HD video recording for high-quality selfies and video calls.Enhanced ConnectivitySupports Wi-Fi 6E (802.11ax) with 2×2 MIMO and Bluetooth 5.3 technology, ensuring fast and reliable wireless connectivity.Versatile Cellular And Wireless ModelsWi-Fi models support Wi-Fi 6E, while Wi-Fi + Cellular models additionally support 5G (sub‑6 GHz and mmWave) and Gigabit LTE for seamless connectivity on the go.Connectivity is elevated with Wi-Fi 6E and Bluetooth 5.3, ensuring swift data transfer and seamless wireless experiences. The inclusion of Touch ID ensures secure access, while the iPadOS 16 unleashes powerful multitasking capabilities. The iPad’s USB-C port supports charging and various display outputs, providing versatility. The device’s robust 28.6‐watt‐hour battery offers up to 10 hours of usage on Wi-Fi. Packaged with a USB-C Charge Cable and a 20W USB-C Power Adapter, the iPad 10th Generation exemplifies Apple’s commitment to innovation and user satisfaction,

Learn moreabout AccessibilityFeatures include:VoiceOver Zoom Magnifier Spoken Content Voice Control Switch Control AssistiveTouch Siri and Dictation Type to Siri Real-Time Text Audio Descriptions Subtitles and Closed Captioning Live CaptionsSystemRequire­mentsApple ID (required for some features)Internet access12Syncing to a Mac or PC requires: macOS Catalina 10.15 or later using the FindermacOS High Sierra 10.13 through macOS Mojave 10.14.6 using iTunes 12.9 or laterWindows 10 or later using iTunes 12.12.10 or later (free download from apple.com/itunes/download)LocationAll modelsDigital compassWi-FiiBeacon micro-locationWi-Fi + Cellular modelsGPS/GNSSCellularSensorsFace IDLiDAR ScannerThree-axis gyroAccelerometerBarometerAmbient light sensors Apple iPad Pro M4 Review DetailsThe latestApple iPad Pro M4 11 Inch Wi-fi 2024 is a versatile tablet that can be used for work or entertainment. With its strong cores, the M4 CPU provides excellent performance for demanding activities like 3D modeling, editing videos (up to 8K quality), and multitasking with ease. With its impressive 264 pixels per inch (PPI) and 11-inch size, the Liquid Retina XDR display is certain to impress with its incredible detail, vivid colors, and high dynamic range in everything you see, be it images, movies, or even online browsing. The iPad Pro M4, with its potent M4 CPU and high refresh rate display (120Hz), can run several popular games smoothly even if it’s not a dedicated gaming tablet. With its dual camera setup, the 12MP wide and ultrawide cameras produce videos and photos that look professional. The LiDAR scanner, on the other hand, improves low-light autofocus and depth sensing for augmented reality applications. You can work or play uninterrupted thanks to Face ID for safe unlocking and a long-lasting battery life that powers you through the day. With its M4 chip, stunning Ultra Retina Tandem OLED display, and 8160 mAh battery that ensures a long battery life, the iPad Pro M4 is a powerful and portable tablet that’s ideal for creative professionals, students, and everyday users.The world’s most advanced display.The new Ultra Retina XDR display introduces groundbreaking tandem OLED technology. Extreme brightness, incredibly precise contrast, and advanced technologies like ProMotion and True Tone give you a jaw-dropping visual experience. And you can use Reference Mode for color-accurate workflows.Rocket chipIntroducing M4, the next generation of Apple silicon, delivering outrageous performance in the exceptionally thin and light design of iPad Pro. An entirely new display engine enables stunning precision, color, and brightness. A powerful GPU with hardware-accelerated ray tracing renders game-changing graphics. And the Neural Engine in M4 makes iPad Pro an absolute powerhouse for AI.Apple Pencil Pro. Engineered for limitless creativity.Apple Pencil sets the standard for how drawing, painting, handwriting, and note-taking should feel — intuitive, precise, and magical. All with pixel‑perfect precision, low latency, tilt sensitivity, and support for palm rejection. The all-new Apple Pencil Pro adds even more capabilities to bring your ideas to life like never beforeMagic Keyboard. Innovation is key.Magic Keyboard delivers an amazing typing and trackpad experience in a sleek, portable new design with an aluminum palm rest.1 The keyboard includes a function row and a larger glass trackpad with haptic feedback for precise work and Multi‑Touch gestures.Mics. Cameras. Action.Shoot, edit, and share all on one device with a pro camera system with LiDAR Scanner, studio-quality mics, and four speakers. Capture 4K ProRes video, hop on a video call with the new landscape front camera, and take dramatically better document scans enhanced by AI.Designed to make a difference.What matters to you matters to Apple, too. From using more recycled materials that minimize environmental impact. To privacy protections that give you more control over your data. To creating built‑in features that make iPad accessible to all.

details.description_text: OnePlus Pad LiteSlim, lightweight, stylish Aero Blue 11-inch 90Hz IPS LCD display Mediatek Helio G100, decent performance OxygenOS 15, clean Android experience Quad speakers, Hi-Res audio support 9340mAh battery, 33W fast charging Basic 5MP cameras, weak photography Stylus support for notes/drawing ..................................................................................... Warranty Policy: If You Want to Claim the Warranty You Must Submit Box Along with Accessories. Physical Damage or Dent/Scratch Will Not Be Acceptable for Warranty. No Warranty For Charging cable. DetailsOnePlus Pad Lite - in BangladeshOnePlus is expanding its tablet lineup with the OnePlus Pad Lite, a more affordable alternative to the flagship OnePlus Pad. With an 11-inch 90Hz display, Mediatek Helio G100 chipset, and OxygenOS 15, it aims to deliver a smooth experience for media consumption and light productivity. gyroAccelerometerBarometerAmbient light sensor Apple iPad Air 6 Review DetailsIntroducing the revolutionary iPad Air (6th generation) – meticulously crafted by Apple Inc. and unveiled on May 7, 2024, marking a new era in tablet technology.Powered by the groundbreaking Apple M2 SoC, equipped with 8 GB of RAM, and 128/256 GB of onboard flash storage, expandable up to an impressive 1 TB for those who demand more. The M2 chip, featuring 8 CPU cores and 9 GPU cores, ensures lightning-fast performance and seamless multitasking.Immerse yourself in the stunning visuals of the Liquid Retina Display, featuring 500 nits of brightness and a wide P3 color space. Choose between the 11-inch model, boasting a vibrant 2360 by 1440 display, or the larger 13-inch model with a breathtaking 2372 by 2048 display. Both models support the Apple Pencil Pro and Apple Pencil (USB-C), enabling you to unleash your creativity with precision.Capture life’s moments in stunning detail with the 12 MP front and back cameras, enhanced by Smart HDR 4 technology for breathtaking photos and up to 63 MP panorama shots.Stay connected like never before with the USB-C port, capable of lightning-fast data transfer speeds of up to 10 Gbit/s and DisplayPort capabilities for seamless connectivity to external monitors. Enjoy blazing-fast WiFi 6E (802.11ax) and Bluetooth 5.3 connectivity on all models, with cellular variants offering sub-6 GHz 5G support for ultimate versatility.Design and DisplayThe overall design of the latest iPad Air remains unchanged from its predecessors. As such, it has the same monotone finish and comes with a single camera on the back. It ships in four color options: Blue, Purple, Starlight, and Space Grey. While the Apple iPad Air (2024) looks the same for the most part, it is available in two screen sizes for the first time.The screen sizes it is available on are 11 and 13 inches. The Apple iPad Air was available in the former size previously, however, we are getting the larger 13 inches as well for 2024. Either way, it is a Liquid Retina display (IPS LCD) with True Tone and antireflective coating. Additionally, the screen covers a wide P3 color gamut. In the meantime, the smaller of the two options peaks at 500 nits of brightness while the larger can push an extra 100 nits of brightness.PerformanceThe 2024 version of the Apple iPad Air once again packs an M-series chip for its performance. The American company shipped the iPad Air (2022) with M1 chips. Similarly, the latest variant is getting upgraded with the M2 chip which is built on a second-gen 5nm nodeFurthermore, the chip has eight CPU and 10 GPU cores respectively. Other than that, this tablet comes with 8GB RAM and 128GB storage while booting on iPad OS 17.4Camera and the restIn terms of optics, the Apple iPad Air (2024) comes with two cameras altogether, both of which are 12-megapixel each. The front camera here is an ultrawide unit aligned horizontally with support for the “Center Stage” feature. Meanwhile, the rear shooter is a wide camera with 4K video recording capabilities.

gyroAccelerometerBarometerAmbient light sensor Apple iPad Air 6 Review DetailsIntroducing the revolutionary iPad Air (6th generation) – meticulously crafted by Apple Inc. and unveiled on May 7, 2024, marking a new era in tablet technology.Powered by the groundbreaking Apple M2 SoC, equipped with 8 GB of RAM, and 128/256 GB of onboard flash storage, expandable up to an impressive 1 TB for those who demand more. The M2 chip, featuring 8 CPU cores and 9 GPU cores, ensures lightning-fast performance and seamless multitasking.Immerse yourself in the stunning visuals of the Liquid Retina Display, featuring 500 nits of brightness and a wide P3 color space. Choose between the 11-inch model, boasting a vibrant 2360 by 1440 display, or the larger 13-inch model with a breathtaking 2372 by 2048 display. Both models support the Apple Pencil Pro and Apple Pencil (USB-C), enabling you to unleash your creativity with precision.Capture life’s moments in stunning detail with the 12 MP front and back cameras, enhanced by Smart HDR 4 technology for breathtaking photos and up to 63 MP panorama shots.Stay connected like never before with the USB-C port, capable of lightning-fast data transfer speeds of up to 10 Gbit/s and DisplayPort capabilities for seamless connectivity to external monitors. Enjoy blazing-fast WiFi 6E (802.11ax) and Bluetooth 5.3 connectivity on all models, with cellular variants offering sub-6 GHz 5G support for ultimate versatility.Design and DisplayThe overall design of the latest iPad Air remains unchanged from its predecessors. As such, it has the same monotone finish and comes with a single camera on the back. It ships in four color options: Blue, Purple, Starlight, and Space Grey. While the Apple iPad Air (2024) looks the same for the most part, it is available in two screen sizes for the first time.The screen sizes it is available on are 11 and 13 inches. The Apple iPad Air was available in the former size previously, however, we are getting the larger 13 inches as well for 2024. Either way, it is a Liquid Retina display (IPS LCD) with True Tone and antireflective coating. Additionally, the screen covers a wide P3 color gamut. In the meantime, the smaller of the two options peaks at 500 nits of brightness while the larger can push an extra 100 nits of brightness.PerformanceThe 2024 version of the Apple iPad Air once again packs an M-series chip for its performance. The American company shipped the iPad Air (2022) with M1 chips. Similarly, the latest variant is getting upgraded with the M2 chip which is built on a second-gen 5nm nodeFurthermore, the chip has eight CPU and 10 GPU cores respectively. Other than that, this tablet comes with 8GB RAM and 128GB storage while booting on iPad OS 17.4Camera and the restIn terms of optics, the Apple iPad Air (2024) comes with two cameras altogether, both of which are 12-megapixel each. The front camera here is an ultrawide unit aligned horizontally with support for the “Center Stage” feature. Meanwhile, the rear shooter is a wide camera with 4K video recording capabilities.
